page.title: 16Airfield Wimbish
page.content: About 10% of the area is owned by the Ministry of Defence.Before the mid 1930's the land was occupied by two farms Abbotts Manor and Shafts.No trace of the latter farm exists. When the Ministry first took over the land for an airfield it was known as Wimbish Airfield,however as radio communications in those days were not too good, to avoid confusion with Wisbech 80 Kms., to the North, it was renamed Debden Airfield.It saw active service during the Second World War and later in peacetime it was used by the R.A.F.for the training of their police dogs.In 1973 the Air Force left and in 1979 the airfield was renamed Carver Barracks,after Field Marshal Lord Carver,who was Chief of the Defence Staff 1973 to 1976.
